clinical_study.brief_title: Relation Between PRST Score, Skin Conductance and BIS
clinical_study.official_title: The Relation Between PRST Score, Skin Conductance and BIS Values During Anesthesia

lead_sponsor.agency: Diskapi Yildirim Beyazit Education and Research Hospital

clinical_study.source: Diskapi Yildirim Beyazit Education and Research Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: Determine the relation between PRST (pressure, rate, sweating, tears) score, skin conductance (SC) and Bispectral index (BIS) values during anesthesia

detailed_description.textblock: Probability of >0 points in the PRST as a function of BIS and number of fluctuations in mean skin conductance (NFSC) will be recorded during the anesthesia.

primary_outcome.measure: Correlation between NFSC, PRST and BIS
primary_outcome.time_frame: anesthesia induction (while giving induction agent to the patient), surgical incision (when the surgeon makes the first incision), extubation (when LMA is removed)
primary_outcome.description: Correlation between NFSC-PRST and, BIS-PRST will be assessed.

intervention.description: The bispectral index (BIS) and skin conductance (SC) monitors will be connected when patient will be positioned on the operating table. A BIS value greater than 60 will be considered an indicator of light anaesthesia. The SC monitoring will be achieved using the MEDSTORM AS 2005 monitor. Number of fluctuations in mean skin conductance (NFSC) of >0.1 s-1 in a period of 15 s might be counted as a significant change and indicates an increase in the sympathetic outflow. General anaesthesia will be performed and laryngeal mask will be inserted. Blood pressure, heart rate, BIS, SC, and PRST (pressure, rate, sweating, tears) score will be recorded.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Minor elective surgery
- General anaesthesia
Exclusion Criteria:
- autonomic neuropathy
- presence of a pacemaker
- medication with anticholinergic drugs
- use of ketamine, clonidine
